workItems.description:
Feature Overview

UMDF hosts user-mode drivers in WUDFHost.exe.  UMDF uses few custom Watson events to report driver problems.

Reason for WudfHost termination

Watson Event Type

A driver failed a runtime verification check or called WdfCxVerifierKeBugCheck.

Watson event: WUDFVerifierFailure

The driver host process was terminated by UMDF reflector because the driver failed to respond to a PnP/Power/IO cancelation/Interrupt operation or callback within the stipulated time for that operation. 

Watson Event:

WudfHostProblem


Determining Why the Reflector Terminated the Host Process - Windows drivers

 

A driver caused an unhandled exception e.g. an access violation.

Watson event:

WUDFUnhandledException and other standard Watson events BEX64 


The problem is that we have a very high volume of driver failures (see business justification below) that is not being properly attributed and not brought to the attention of driver teams and driver owners to resolve. While UMDF makes a best effort to auto-recover from these failures, the problems do carry significant customer impact and could degrade user-experience. 

This work covers various changes to improve attribution, reduce the very high volume of failures and significantly improve OS reliability and customer satisfaction. It includes analysis of top-hitters and engage with partners to triage and investigate how to invest in HLK tests to catch problems early.  ELAN fingerprint reader drivers are the highest hitter, so these will be targeted first.

In Germanium improvements were made for 
  • UMDF Watson Error Reporting to improve attribution
  • UMDF Watson Error reporting to capture heap dumps to make failure reports actionable
  • HLK tests to catch UMDF errors during certification. Only DevFund and SysFund tests were extended.
We have seen a good number of bugs discovered through this process. There is still follow up pending to:
  • Take action based on new Watson failure reports. Engage with partners like Surface and Goodix.
  • Remove WudfUnhandledException entirely.
  • Extend UMDF failure detection in HLK tests to all HLK tests. Not just devFund and sysFund tests.
  • Extend UMDF failure detection in internal test passes.

Partner Asks

We will be engaging with several partners (e.g. ELAN, WPD, EnS biometrics team) who are responsible for a very high volume of failures, to make significant inroads into reducing these failures.

Business Justification

Reducing fatal errors in user-mode drivers increases customer satisfaction.  Below outlines known errors (>310 million errors) that are not triaged to a user-driver owner.  Providing actionable failure data to owners significantly increases the likelihood of improvement.
  • WUDFVerifierFailure https://watsonportal.microsoft.com/Bucket?iEventType=236&
    • 140 million errors (from top 5 buckets over 90 days)
  • WUDFUnhandledException https://watsonportal.microsoft.com/Bucket?iEventType=237&OrderBy=1&MaxRows=100
    • 45 million errors (from top 5 buckets over 90 days)
  • WUDFHostProblem  https://watsonportal.microsoft.com/Bucket?iEventType=238&OrderBy=1&MaxRows=100
    • 125 million errors (from top 5 buckets over 90 days)

workItems.description: 4.  Resizing states themselves.  Some state machines have Async states with a lot of ingress and egress transitions; a convenient way to diagram this legibly is to make the state very large so that it has a lot of edge real estate to connect to.  USB4 uses this technique in a few places, and I recall UCSI using it extensively as well.  We discovered yesterday that it was not straightforward to resize the states themselves (and their dimensions weren’t preserved in the conversion) so this technique now results in many transitions converging onto a small area which is harder to read.
workItems.title: Support resizing states

workItems.description:
Hello,
We are from CFE-Browser team under WSD that’s driving the VBScript Deprecation project.

VBScript Deprecation Contacts: Srirama Mogali (EM), Naveen Shankar (PM), Rajiv Chikine (SWE), Raina Sharma (SWE), Rajan Dmello (PM).

Context
VBScript is a legacy scripting language with well-known security vulnerabilities and has not been in active development for the past 20 years. Modern browsers have ceased support for VBScript, with IE11 support concluding in April 2017. To enhance the security of Windows OS, our Windows feature removal & deprecation V-team reviewed and approved it as an ideal deprecation candidate.

We would like to inform you that VBScript is scheduled for deprecation and will be removed from the operating system in upcoming windows OS releases. You can find more details about this in our blog post [blog link provided)]. This deprecation will impact both our 1st party and external (3rd party) applications that rely on VBScript or execute .vbs files.
 
It was identified that your team's files listed below depend on VBScript within the Windows OS image, and these operations will be affected by the deprecation. We are prioritizing 1P migrations to be completed by August 2025. We kindly request that you migrate your dependency on VBScript to other suitable modern technologies to ensure that your operations are not disrupted going forward. The ETA to migrate away from VBScript is August 2025.

The specific file and their respective owner are as follows:
  
/drivers/wdf/kmdf 
OS\Core\Connectivity Platform\Buses\WDF-Windows Driver Frameworks
Shyamal Varma 
Mike Ajax 
 
/drivers/wdm/usb/tools/ 
 
shyv@ntdev.microsoft.com 
miajax@microsoft.com 


Ask: We strongly encourage you to start migrating your file dependencies on VBScript as soon as possible. For guidance on how to migrate, please refer to the relevant section in the blog  - VBA projects that use VBScript.
 
We are here to guide on the deprecation timelines and collaborate with you throughout your migration journey. Please feel free to reach out to us for any further clarifications or assistance you may need.

workItems.description:
Design Spec 8.1.1 UmdfHostProcessSharing

[DDInstall.NT.Wdf]
UmdfDirectHardwareAccess = AllowDirectHardwareAccessAndDma
UmdfHostProcessSharing = ProcessSharingDisabled

Note that we also support the unpublic registry entry DeviceGroupId.

[DDInstall.NT.HW]
AddReg = DeviceGroupId_AddReg

[DeviceGroupId_AddReg]
HKR,"WUDF","DeviceGroupId",0x00000000,"<group-id>"

workItems.description:
Customer + Situation Product Magic Outcomes
Who is the customer? What motivates him or her? What is the specific real-world situation where there is a need or an opportunity? What specific problem does the customer have? 🪄🪄🪄 What specific outcomes has the customer now been able to accomplish? What are the key metrics to measure the success of these outcomes?
Bug fixes for Input/HID/Sensors, USB, Low Power Buses and WDF ➡️ The customer will achieve a 50% reduction in UCSI LKDs indicating USB-C PPM firmware failures and a significant reduction in USB XHCI controller resets. Key metrics include the number of reported failures and the effectiveness of WHCP tests

Key Work to be Done

  • Bug fixes for Input/HID/Sensors, USB, Low Power Buses and WDF
  • Enhance WHCP tests to detect hardware issues upstream. 
  • Implement automated UCSI tests through a software UCSI client 
  • Improve diagnostics and leverage IFR more effectively 
  • Reduce Watson failures indicating USB XHCI controller resets

Voice of the Customer and Business Justification 

  • Improving the reliability of USB controllers and USB-C PPM firmware will enhance user experience, reduce support costs, and maintain the competitiveness of the Windows platform. These improvements are critical for both inbox drivers and third-party device drivers. 
  •  1: Reduction in the number of USB XHCI controller resets. There are about 7 million reports in 30 days. Considering the 1 billion+ systems with USB controllers that are heavily exercised each day, this is a relatively small number but in absolute terms it still represents failures that cause user dissatisfaction with the product. These are indicative of hardware issues, but we will continue to enhance WHCP tests to detect these are drive quality upstream to reduce the number. 
  •  2: 50% reduction in the number of UCSI LKDs that indicate a failure of the USB-C PPM firmware. Today that number is at ~13 million in 30 days. 
  •  3: Automated UCSI tests through a software UCSI client. Associated HLK test improvements that will drive quality upstream to prevent faulty PPMs from entering the market and contributing to the UCSI failures. 
  •  4: Engineering efficiency improvements that reduce triage and support cost. Improved diagnostics and leverage IFR more effectively. 
  •  5: Reduce Watson failures that indicate USB XHCI controller resets. The USB XHCI stack automatically recovers from a variety of USB host controller failures. While there is a level of self-healing it is not entirely transparent to the user. When the controller needs to reset, every USB device on the controller will observe a re-enumeration. This includes audio devices, input devices, cameras, biometric devices, mobile broadband devices, Bluetooth radios and network adapters. Integrated and external peripheral devices would be impacted. In the best case, the user will experience a transient glitch if the recovery is successful, and applications deal with the re-enumeration robustly. In the worst case, the device could become non-functional and require a reboot to recover.

What is a Scenario?

A scenario is a specific and tangible experience that we expect to complete and ship in a given release.
More Details at: https://www.osgwiki.com/wiki/Scenario


Feature Submitted. To See FA Details Click Here

Feature Submitted. To See FA Details Click Here

workItems.description:
From : 2025_10-23 Windows Desktop Readiness meeting this is a request to investigate adding new Hardware USB measures or tell us if not feasible. 

  • This is tracking investigation of new measures for USB.
Situation: several high impact USB related issues have been hit externally, and we need to catch them first. 

  • This came up in context of reviewing GE for RP but should also be considered future looking
  • Consider maybe more than 1 type of issue - we recently hit 3 different issues.
  •  consider if there are gaps or communication tweaks we can make to improve.

P1: Add new USB measures 
  • If new measures cannot be added, further steps will be determined
workItems.title: [Windows Desktop Readiness] meeting 10/23 AI :  investigation of new measures for USB
